definition[0]: to prevent the size, cost, or quantity of something from increasing or being too great
example[0]: We need to keep costs down.
definition[1]: to succeed in keeping food in your stomach, instead of bringing it up again out of your mouth, when you are ill
example[1]: I could hardly keep anything down for about three days.
definition[2]: used to ask someone to make less noise
example[2]: Keep your voice down – she’ll hear you!
example[3]: Can you keep it down – I’m trying to work.
definition[3]: to prevent a group of people from becoming as successful and powerful as the other people in a society
example[4]: Plantation owners kept slaves down by refusing them an education.
